item.title: Walt add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "It is sometimes an appropriate response to reality to go insane." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Walt add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "Reality is that which, when you stop believing in it, doesn't go away." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Walt add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "The true measure of a man is not his intelligence or how high he rises in this freak establishment. No, the true measure of a man is this: how quickly can he respond to the needs of others and how much of himself he can give." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Walt add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "No single thing abides; and all things are fucked up." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Walt add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "My schedule for today lists a six-hour self-accusatory depression." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Walt add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "The basic tool for the manipulation of reality is the manipulation of words. If you can control the meaning of words, you can control the people who must use them." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Walt add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "This, to me, is the ultimately heroic trait of ordinary people; they say no to the tyrant and they calmly take the consequences of this resistance." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Walt add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "Certainly it constitutes bad news when the people who agree with you are buggier than batshit." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Walt add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "If you think this Universe is bad, you should see some of the others." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Walt add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "Don't try to solve serious matters in the middle of the night." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Walt add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "How'd you like to gaze at a beer can throughout eternity? It might not be so bad. There'd be nothing to fear." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Walt add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "Fish cannot carry guns." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Walt add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "There will come a time when it isn't 'They're spying on me through my phone' anymore. Eventually, it will be 'My phone is spying on me'." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Walt add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "If I'd known it was harmless, I'd have killed it myself!" -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Walt add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "Science fiction writers, I am sorry to say, really do not know anything. We can't talk about science, because our knowledge of it is limited and unofficial, and usually our fiction is dreadful." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Walt add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "I like her; I could watch her the rest of my life. She has breasts that smile." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Walt add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "The distinction between sanity and insanity is narrower than a razor’s edge, sharper than a hound’s tooth, more agile than a mule deer. It is more elusive than the merest phantom. Perhaps it does not even exist; perhaps it is a phantom. " -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Walt add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "The pre-Socratic Greek philosopher [author:Parmenides|357208] taught that the only things that are real are things which never change... and the pre-Socratic Greek philosopher [author:Heraclitus|77989] taught that everything changes. If you superimpose their two views, you get this result: Nothing is real." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Walt add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "The cries of the dead are terrible indeed; you should try not to hear them." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Walt add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "You will be required to do wrong no matter where you go. It is the basic condition of life, to be required to violate your own identity. At some time, every creature which lives must do so. It is the ultimate shadow, the defeat of creation; this is the curse at work, the curse that feeds on all life. Everywhere in the universe." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Walt add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "Odd that the brain could function on its own, without acquainting him with its purposes, its reasons. But the brain was an organ, like the spleen, heart, kidneys. And they went about their private activities. So why not the brain?" -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Walt add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "Emigrate or Degenerate." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Walt add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "There is no route out of the maze. The maze shifts as you move through it, because it is alive. " -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Walt add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "I'd like to see you move up to the goat class, where I think you belong." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Walt add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "In a one-party system there is always a landslide." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Walt add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "How undisturbed, the sleep of the foolish." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Walt add a quote by David Peoples
item.description: "I've seen things you people wouldn't believe. Attack ships on fire off the shoulder of Orion. I watched C-beams glitter in the dark near the Tannhauser gate. All those moments will be lost in time, like tears in rain." -- David Peoples

item.title: Walt add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "Everybody knows that Aristotelian two-value logic is fucked." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Walt add a quote by Joe R. Lansdale
item.description: "Hallowed be thy name, oh Lord -- and shotgun do your stuff" -- Joe R. Lansdale

item.title: Walt add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Those who believe in telekinetics, raise my hand." -- Kurt Vonnegut
